Your steak is still raw chewed right to the bone the banter around you.
The Muse in the tower, / whose debt you enthrone / Those jewels that you borrow, / —her crown still on loan.

My Grandfather was a Poet, / my Father was a thief / Their spirits fight to own my soul / —my Son in cradle sleeps / My Grandfather spoke of beauty, / my Father spoke of sin / The truth now locked within a voice / —whose key I leave to him
From the rock of ages, a pebble thrown. A thundering crash— from David's stone.
Can the lie you’ve lived before today—get one last second chance?
The reasoning sands / and factual concrete. / From thin ice to thick, / what’s now indiscreet. / Decisions and choices / are still made the same / But to rent or to own / —real estate of this game.
The steak is served raw Chewed right to the bone The banter around you Seems damning at best

And distance from the many women / he tried to love and failed / No matter how far he lived afield, / be it Paris, Havana, or Ketchum / In no place was there distance enough / or where his words could be safe. / The separation and memory loss / became deafening and finally too much / As he gave in to the distance / —one last and final time.
A scant twenty years, grieved a century or more Poetically perfect, in spirit and lore A man and his horse alone on the range.
Everything written to inspire / makes the old new again / In ways that only / the heart can feel / —and the spirit know
A mirrored reflection of what never comes out.
Jazz without melody, / an arm with no hand / A heart without blood / —a sea with no land.
Will you / Or won't you, / Can you / Or can't you, / Another paradox / Unclaimed
You can feel, but no longer find / the love / Surrounding, no longer inside / the love / Remembering, / you cannot forget / the love Lingering, / you wander in search —of love.
Envy is a curse with the darkest shadow / Its yearning left unsettled in a greenish cast / Jealousy its evil twin beyond veracity purview / Coveting the burning torches —of all darkness past.
The gray dawn slaughters / the promise of Spring / Winter’s desperate last goodbye
Like clubs inside my golf bag / each verse a different face / Some to drive straight down the course / others lift and then embrace.
If language a bullet, / the pen is my gun / Its wound self inflicted, / —the verse zero-sum.
If only insight could be replayed, / like a Mozart symphony / Then epiphany’s light would shine on all / —in communal rhapsody.
And wander esoteric into notions barred to them
Allowed to grow unfettered, allowed to grow unnamed. Allowed to grow beyond myself, connected once again.

Looking beyond our differences, / the transformation deepened / Speaking without words, / the conversation spiked / Touching without holding on, / all feelings turned to ecstasy / Loving while letting go / —the caterpillar's delight.

Stuck on the broken landing / Of a stairway to nowhere / My mood no longer elevated / My spirit remiss of song / Looking over the railing / Into a history that I buried / A ladder appears above me / But when I step—its rungs are gone.
My swing is then adjusted / as words take off and fly / And landing safe beyond the trap / to make the devil cry.
A highway of regret… / an avenue of denial.
The cruelest thing about life —is that it can be taken away.

You bought one more tomorrow, / from my borrowed yesterdays / My voice to sing with Angels, / your love the music plays / You bought one more tomorrow, / from my darkened yesterday's / Replacing grief and sorrow, / —with a torch that lights my way.
A Cowboy never says goodbye, the wind his closest friend A Cowboy never says goodbye -- his heart to only lend.
I wish for tomorrow, / as today slips away / Each moment more precious, / the end drawing near / I pray for myself, / in spite of myself / Hoping God is still listening / —my soul a deaf ear.
To see past tomorrow, / today in freefall / A binary motion / of polar extremes / All consciousness split / —dark hole of my dreams
The Poet of Las Vegas Boulevard / steals emotion from the night / Holding a vigil in the darkness / waiting for the light
Our story rechristened, / linked moments in time / New legacy written / —in couplets of rhyme
Everyone has to be somewhere / unless they're in-between / Places caught beyond now and then / —with destiny unseen.
Memories of memories, / illusions called the past / Their structure self deceptive, / inside our minds ill cast

Do you burrow on blindly, or tunnel beyond / What your comfort will dictate, what the blackness desponds / One choice lands in darkness, one reaches for light / My tracks through the shadows, your fear cannot light.
Beyond genius the heavens sing beyond genius that final thing.	Beyond genius the heavens sing beyond genius that final thing.
His words left behind / to inspire and remind / —of those things that we still have to learn
From lies and confusion, the wrongs became right. My days now lengthened, —turning darkness to light.
Before you fall, / you've got to stand / Your voice once stalled, / fates reprimand / The paradigm floats, / on swamps that drain / Where praise cries out / —false hope again.
Because in the end, a community of friends / —let you rise and then stand tall.
Living on the surface, your reflection flat and clean
Be it Melville or Tolstoy / or a Pen still to burn / Know the words are just borrowed / —until silence returns.
If you stop where you are, / you’ll die where you stand / Those choices you make / —to forever command.
I’m tired of forgiving, / —your constant complaining / But I’m most tired of wishing, / —when the hope turns to pain
The perfume of your silence lingers,—in scented feelings without words.
